Transcription for 547597

The world away to thee alone, from sin and death we came.
And he who would the Father see, must seek him, Lord, by thee.
Thus therefore never, yes, we are, beneath the mountain range.
The hookless ear of faith, the love, the ear of love may bleed.
For still unquench'd with the great voice, Thou leadest not the way.
But all human in power, Christ, dead, holy, young, and free.
Thou art the truth, my word alone, through wisdom and in heart.
Thou only canst give form the mind, and purify the heart.
